alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 30 at 7:17PM CST until February 03 at 3:36PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana... Amite River At Bayou Manchac Point affecting East Baton Rouge Parish. Amite River At Denham Springs affecting East Baton Rouge and Livingston Parishes. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING TO FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Amite River At Bayou Manchac Point. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening to Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, The river will begin to flood property along Bayou Manchac and the Amite River. Amite River Road and Horseshoe Drive will be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. The last observed value was 7.5 ft at 6:20 am this morning. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow evening to a crest of 9.5 feet early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
